morph.item: odd use of -hch that I can't classify...

word.item: A village once lay where a river came out near the ocean.
At night a hen would cackle on the water.
Or else a rooster would crow.
Or (perhaps) dogs would bark on the water.
One day (the people of this village) got up very early, (and) when they opened the door, a young woman was sitting behind it.

morph.item: to ask a question; to inquire

word.item: “Have you heard a hen cackling at night?” she said.
“Or else a rooster crowing?” she said.
‎‎“Now you prepared something unfit to eat and I ate that.
Now I cannot return (home),” she said.
“May I not stay with you?” she said.
A young man was courting her.
he led her to his house
After he married her, he took her home with him.
They raised two or three children.
When seven years had passed, she spoke to him.
“(The time) has come (for) me to return to my home.
If you take good care of the boys, it will be a good thing,” she said.
He was going along behind her and talking to her.
She was saying to him, it is said
“Nevertheless, (the time) has come to go back home,” she told him.
She was going into the water.
She got (in it) up to her waist and stopped.
When she (had) finished speaking to him, she dived into the water.
Then he turned back and went home.

morph.item: preverb "up, down," also used as a resultative

word.item: One day (while) he was at home she came back again before he knew it.
Seven years had passed (when) she came.
I have come to stay,” she said.
She was saying to him, it is said
After she (had) stayed (for) seven years, she would go back again, she told him.
“If you want to come to my home, I shall take you (along),” she said.

morph.item: to turn (a certain length of time)

word.item: When seven years had passed, she started back to her home.
When they got near the ocean, she spoke to him.

morph.item: preverb "up, down," also used as a resultative

word.item: When they got into the water up to their waists, they stopped.
She was saying to him, it is said
“When I dive, you are to come there and dive behind (me in the place) where my feet make a ripple. If we get (to the place) where (there is) a door, it will be a good thing,” she told him
It turned out that way; when they came to the door it opened (revealing) a country.
She had taken him to her people.
